objective.paragraph: The study measures consumer preference in non-alcoholic beer using simulated shopping choice tasks plus follow-up questions to understand what drives selection.
bullets: Behavioral choice tasks (1v1 comparisons and multi-brand lineups)
Post-task reasoning (why participants chose what they chose)

experimentalDesign.designType: Within-subject; participants see multiple scenarios so comparisons are within the same participant.
experimentalDesign.rationale: Compare mother-brand options vs non-mother / fictional options to isolate branding effects.
experimentalDesign.environment: Simulated e-commerce storefront experience; participants browse products and add to cart.

brandSetRationale.paragraph: The brand set mixes mother brands, established competitors, independent brands, and fictional brands to test reputation transfer, benchmarks vs incumbents, novelty/packaging influence, and a zero-familiarity baseline.
brandSetRationale.callout: Fictional brands help remove prior associations and isolate mother-brand equity.

recruitment.note: Prolific IDs recorded for tracking and quality control.

stages.description: Check timing, clarity, and task comprehension.
